revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=WNDR4000 |revision= |upc=606449077629= |asin=B004PA2B6C |est_release_date=02/27/2011 |fcc_date=03/03/2011 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12H181 |manuf_rev=T00 |availability=common |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PY310400144 |ic_id=4054A-10400144 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4718A1;BCM4718A1KFBG, CS1116 P11, 132814 N1; |cpu1_cspeed=480 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L6445E |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9751G6JB-25 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag=yes |serial=yes |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4718A1;BCM4718A1KFBG, CS1116 P11, 132814 N1; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4331;BCM4331KMLG, TE1038 P21, 999195 3 W; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53115 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2528L;SiGe, 2528L, 110BK;2; ,,, 2.4/5GHz Front End Module;Skyworks;SE2594L;SiGe, SE2594L, 247EN;3; |flags= |tp_firmware=DD-WRT,Tomato (Hyzoom) |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=password |oui=20:4E:7F,20:E5:2A,4C:60:DE,A0:21:B7,C4:3D:C7,E0:46:9A,E0:91:F5 |oui_eth=20:4E:7F,20:E5:2A,4C:60:DE,A0:21:B7,C4:3D:C7,E0:46:9A,E0:91:F5 }} {{TagLine|N750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router}} :[http://www.netgear.com/home/products/wirelessrouters/high-performance/wndr4000.aspx Product Page] {{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=WNDR4000|vs_id=18164}}
The manual states the default SSIDs are ''NETGEAR'' (b/g/n radio) and ''NETGEAR-5G'' :(a/n radio).. but ''NETGEARXX'' and ''NETGEARXX-5G'' may instead be used.
"U12H181T00" and "REV. 1 GP" is silkscreened on the main [http://img-fotki.yandex.ru/get/6726/20776875.3/0_f8bbf_8ac41534_orig.jpg board]. :OEM: [[Foxconn]] U12H181T00
===Wikis=== *{{TechInfoDepot|Netgear_WNDR4000}} *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Netgear_WNDR4000 On the '''DD-WRT''' Wiki] *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/netgear/wndr4000 On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki]
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31474-netgear-wndr4000-n750-wireless-dual-band-gigabit-router-reviewed ''Netgear WNDR4000'' Reviewed on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :C4:3D:C7 OUI
===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=90600 On the '''DD-WRT''' forums]
===Third party firmware support=== This device should be well supported by '''DD-WRT''' (see wiki + forum posts below) :and partially supported by '''OpenWrt''' <small>([http://downloads.openwrt.org/barrier_breaker/14.07/brcm47xx/mips74k/openwrt-wndr4000-squashfs.chk Barrier Breaker (14.07) build])</small>.
While there is an '''OpenWrt''' build available, b43 currently lacks 11n support.
There is also support from [http://www.linksysinfo.org/index.php?threads/tomato-hyzoom-bwq518-releases.70364/ Tomato Hyzoom]
==Images== <gallery caption="images orignally posted on the TomatoUSB forums, mirrored here"> File:Wndr4000 routerinsidepartial001 2.jpg|partial view File:Wndr4000 routerinsidefull 2.jpg|internal overview File:Wndr4000 radio001 2.jpg|radio1 File:Wndr4000 radio002 2.jpg|radio2 File:Wndr4000 broadcomprocessor001 2.jpg|CPU File:Wndr4000 routerbackclosed 2.jpg|back and label </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::label| ]]
